contentList.content: A warrior who has undergone extensive training, ruthless mental and physical conditioning, and mysterious rituals
Extensive training, ruthless physical conditioning, and mysterious rituals transformed you into a perfect monster slayer.

The Wolf School emphasizes a balance between swordplay and Signs. Wolf School Witchers conduct extensive research and preparation before battle, placing great importance on tactical application in real combat - earning them the title of true masters of the hunt.

Witchers of the Cat School are well known for their agility and assassination skills. However, the side effects of the mutating experiments have led to members having emotional outbursts and a weak sense of morality. They are equipped with light leather armor, and their combat style is similar to that of the elves, emphasizing continuous rapid attacks and precise ambushes.

The Griffin School venerates knightly virtues and typically dons full plate armor. They place great emphasis on arcane studies and Signs manipulation, possessing vast arcane lore and practical experience in magical combat.

The Viper School's founders were renowned for their clairvoyance, and the school became the earliest faction to investigate the Wild Hunt phenomenon and the impending White Frost cataclysm. Moreover, its Witchers are consummate practitioners of toxic arts.

The Bear School specializes in defense and brute strength, donning heavy composite armor. Perhaps shaped by the untamed environment and warrior culture of Skellige Isles, these Witchers favor direct confrontation - charging headlong into battle, engaging enemies face - to - face, and even taking on hordes single - handedly.

Memories at Kaer Morhen are a precious treasure. When you kill enemies in combat, you gain memory fragments based on their level. These fragments allow you to recall the Witcher Wolf School's legacy.
I remember Vesemir often said: "To survive in this world, knowledge is more important than your swordsmanship."
Spending these memory fragments unlocks different abilities.
Spend memory fragments to recall your past life and gain benefits.

Consume 20 Memory Shards, Attack Throw +2, you gain proficiency in Athletics, Acrobatics, Stealth, Investigation, Medicine, and Survival. At the same time, Melee attacks have an independent 20% chance to deal slashing damage equal to 6% of the target’s max HP.

In my youth, I stepped into the snow-covered fortress of Kaer Morhen and met the silent and stern Vesemir. Here, I learned my first sword steps, how to grip a blade, and for the first time understood the solitude of a Witcher.
Memory II: Trial of the Grasses

Unlocked at Witcher level 5, consume 40 Memory Shards. Inherit previous memories while increasing Toxicity limit by +2, Vitality by +30. At the same time, Melee attacks have an independent 20% chance to deal slashing damage equal to 7% of the target’s max HP.

Harsh training, poisonous concoctions, and perilous trials came one after another. I struggled in agony, yet with each brush against death I learned resilience. Vesemir often said: “Pain teaches you what is real.”
Memory III: Rise of the Wolf

Unlocked at Witcher level 7, consume 60 Memory Shards. Inherit previous memories while Initiative +3, immune to Fear and Frightened conditions. At the same time, Melee attacks have an independent 20% chance to deal slashing damage equal to 8% of the target’s max HP.

The first time I faced a real monster, fear nearly made me forget my training. But when the silver sword cleaved through the darkness, I finally understood that knowledge and composure are the true keys to victory.
Memory IV: The Hunt of the Wolf

Unlocked at Witcher level 9, consume 80 Memory Shards. Inherit previous memories while Spell Damage +10, Melee Physical Damage +2d8, allies attacking enemies near you gain Advantage. At the same time, Melee attacks and witcher's signs have an independent 20% chance to deal force damage equal to 9% of the target’s max HP.

I was no longer alone, but had companions, comrades, and lovers. I wandered courts and countryside, sharpening my mind and honing my craft. Swordplay and Signs grew ever more refined. People began to call me “Witcher,” “Master,” rather than “mutant.”

Unlocked at Witcher level 11, consume 100 Memory Shards. Inherit previous memories while all Saving Throws +5, all Attributes +2. At the same time, Melee attacks and witcher's signs have an independent 20% chance to deal force damage equal to 10% of the target’s max HP.

Years passed, and I reached a hundred. Steel and silver swords became extensions of my hands; monsters and men’s hearts alike were transparent before me. I had become the pride of Kaer Morhen, the last master of the School of the Wolf.
